newsitem.title: HONG KONG: RESEARCH ALERT - Merrill ups Jardine Math.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Merrill ups Jardine Math.

text.p: Merrill Lynch has made an upward revision to its 1997 profit forecasts for Jardine Matheson Holdings Ltd and said the conglomerate appeared "poised for recovery".

"We now forecast a modest five percent rebound in trading profit in 1997, with a 13 percent forecast decline in JF (Jardine Fleming) more than offset by gains in other businesses, particularly JP (Jardine Pacific), where we forecast a 14 percent rebound," Merrill Lynch said in a recent report.
In 1998, it forecast 13 percent growth in trading profit, fuelled by Jardine Pacific, and by good growth from the merged Jardine Lloyd Thompson and Dairy Farm, among others.
Jardine Matheson was trading at a 45 percent discount to the Hong Kong conglomerate sector, and a 17 percent discount to its book value of US$7.09 a share, Merrill Lynch said.

"We believe that JM (Jardine Matheson) should benefit from the recent 'assurances' from China on ensuring a level playing field," Merrill Lynch said, referring to recent signs of improved relations between Jardine Matheson's management and the Chinese government.
